channel.title: KBot
channel.description:
KBot is one of my recent and ongoing projects. It is pretty obvious it stands for Kosaki's Bot as a result of lack of creativity.
Unlike most other bots is KBot close to done and is pretty much ready to move out of "Alpha" stage and into the "Beta" stage. The only thing that is missing is some anti randoms and optimization. I am hoping to get help on that subject and some of the current community members are up to help me with it.
All internal core stuff is basically done now, but requests for new hooks and features are followed up and most likely added.
So now you might wanna see this bot? Here is a single picture taken a while ago: [img]http://kbot.info/images/phocagallery/recent%20scripts.jpg[/img] You don't see it very good on that picture, but the mouse is using dynamic bezier splines. The positioning of control points are smartly placed for human like mouse movement. the count is also random but depending an the distance to the target. And they also have a random offset.
More screenshots can be found here: http://kbot.info/index.php?option=com_phocagallery&view=category&id=1&Itemid=3
The bot is a multi client, tabbed bot. I am using a modified version of the runescape client, so unfortunately it is not a reflection bot. But personally I don't see the point of using reflection as it is slower and over advanced for the purpose. It is written completely from scratch, but contains part of code that I wrote for xBot.
Tell me what you think and feel free to join our community at http://kbot.info/vb (If you don't like the dark skin, you can just change) Contributions are also appreciated ;)
The project is hosted by sharesource and can be found here: http://sharesource.org/project/kbot/ As of 4-30 there is some major fixes waiting to be committed, but I am not able to commit before tomorrow. The fixed stuff can be found in a TODO thread under the Development/Features section in the community.
As for the financial parts of the bot. It is supposed to live on advertising and donations. By donations I mean donations not monthly subscriptions like RSBot "donations"
Hope you like and feel free to post criticism ;) (However criticism is not the same as pure flaming)

item.title: KBot
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

Tenen:

@quarters: doode, you know the people coding the first bots had waaay more problems then you, and it was much harder for them. yet, they kept there fingers out of there asses and released it for free.

Unless you have a huge problem with reading, I said the bot is going to be free…
Only my scripts will be paid, but since other people can script for it that’s something like every bot has these days…

Trust me they didn’t have way more problems then I have. I’m coding stuff that hasn’t been done yet and even if it has be done nobody released anything about it.
They had to explore the client you mean, uhm that’s exactly what modern day bot makers has to do. As you could see for fixing rsbot I had to add lots of hooks on the way, hooks that weren’t found yet by others and now are used by others a lot (great example: masterx/y).

So just shut up trying to be cool, when you don’t know shit about something.

Read full topic

item.description:
@system wrote:

cuz, once upon a time, a asshole named eric thought his bot was t3h w1n. he made it pay cuz he was like “doode, i have penis.”

after th4t, noobs all over the paalace think they have a penis too, and wana be like mr. eric (who actually has a droopy vagina). so, nun of them got what it takes to make a bot. so, no pay-bots have cum out that lasted.

now, eric is actually the devil.&& quarters is a sum1. thus…eric used his mandgina puwerz and quarters thought it’d be k. (lulz h4x b4n pl0x).

@quarters: doode, you know the people coding the first bots had waaay more problems then you, and it was much harder for them. yet, they kept there fingers out of there asses and released it for free.

item.title: KBot
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:47, topic:276642”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=365314.msg2827199#msg2827199 date=1245115081]

Is QBot going to be opensourced?
[/quote]it sounds disgusting, so i doubt it

This bot however won’t be free. You will have to buy scripts to make it function.

Serious question, why charge money for something like this?[/quote]
It won’t be opensource no. There are many reasons for that, mainly that people don’t want to make shit themselves anymore. They just copy others bots for the larger part.

Frank_ you are always so kind, when you don’t know shit about something. This bot can implement functionality for any java gam. It doesn’t have to load applets itself, it just finds them. It’s a lot more undetectable then current bots (beside scar), while offering the same functionality/speed. It autoupdates without me having to do anything, unless it encouters errors. It supports both HD and LD client, making it less detectable.
I don’t see how those things are disgusting, besides it takes a lot of work to complete and a lot of research in undocumented API’s.

My scripts will be paid (till a certain amount after which everything is free), but it will contain a user scripting engine. So pretty much like most bots these days.

Note most of that info on the site is nearly 5 months old, at that time I was unsure how to do it ;).

Read full topic

item.title: KBot
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“qauters, post:44, topic:276642”][quote author=the bank link=topic=365314.msg2825136#msg2825136 date=1244920896]

[quote author=qauters link=topic=365314.msg2825084#msg2825084 date=1244916268]

Reflection isn’t, however the way all bots I’ve seen (except mine) use it is detectable. Just as detectable as a byte code editing bot.

Sorry to bump an old post, but based on your website’s information on your bot,

This bot is unique in its kind, it finds the applets in the running web browsers and controls it from there.

You’d be using the http://java.sun.com/javase/6/docs/jdk/api/jpda/jdi/index.html to reflect variables in the remote vm? That is detectable. It’s pretty obvious if you’re running the applet in debug mode.

I’m not running the applets in debug mode, nor do I see any reason why that would be needed. You don’t need to debug, to reflect something…
[/quote]Your bot also isn’t Java.

Well since he looked at my site, he probably knows that
[/quote]Speaking of which, slightly off topic, but how did you go about hacking the VM to get the current application?

injecting in the process.[/quote]Is QBot going to be opensourced?

Read full topic
